item.title: Notes on machine learning 1
item.description: Notice: the note only contains the part 1 of the specialization. Regression Model $f(\overrightarrow x)=\overrightarrow w\cdot\overrightarrow x+b=w_1x_1+w_2x_2+…+w_nx_n+b$ Terminology $\overrightarrow x$: features.(It can be scalar if there is only one feature) $y$: the output.(given by dataset) $m$: the number of trianing examples. n: the number of features. $x^{(i)}, y^{(i)}$: the $i$th trianing example. $f(x), \hat y$: the estimated value of y. $\overrightarrow w, b$: parameters of the model. Cost function $J(\overrightarrow w, b) = {1\over2m}\sum_{i=1}^m(f(x^{(i)}) - y^{(i)})^2$
